meanings.definition: To score or mark in advance.
meanings.sent1: Before the game, the coach decided to prescore the players based on their performance in practice.
meanings.sent2: She always prescores her students' assignments to provide feedback before the final submission.
meanings.sent3: The teacher prescored the spelling test, but the students managed to trick her by changing their answers last minute.
meanings.sent4: Prescoring the exam was like predicting the future, trying to foresee how each student would perform.
meanings.sent5: Prescoring the project allowed them to identify potential issues and make improvements early on.

meanings.definition: The act of scoring or marking in advance.
meanings.sent1: The prescoring of the tests helped the teacher organize the grading process efficiently.
meanings.sent2: He was responsible for the prescoring of all the ballots before the election day.
meanings.sent3: The prescoring of the movie ratings was accidentally leaked, causing chaos among the film critics.
meanings.sent4: Her prescoring of the recipes in the cookbook made it easier for users to find their favorite dishes.
meanings.sent5: The prescoring of the competition results was crucial to announce the winners without delay.
